occupation: President at Gary Herman Consulting Services Ltd.
headline: Board Member | Executive Consultant | CEO
summary:
I am a results-driven, strategic, relationship-focused Board Member/Executive Consultant/CEO with 35+ years of experience in industry and public sector organizations. Recognized as an exceptional leader, who drives a positive, customer-focused corporate culture and easily connects at all levels. I am also a MacKay CEO Forums Chair and an Advisor to STS Capital Partners.

As a Senior Executive, I have experience in a Public Crown Agency and multiple industry sectors up to $400M+ in revenues including auto parts, railway trackwork, agricultural equipment, steelmaking, and large capital projects for mining, oil and gas, automotive, construction, aerospace, pulp & paper, marine and clean energy. My proven expertise lies in leadership development, strategic planning, and operations excellence. I’m known as a strong leader who can build teams and successfully motivate and lead an organization. 

My unique background starting in skilled trades combined with a business education including an MBA and ICD.D, sets me apart from other senior leaders as I truly understand the manufacturing world from top to bottom. These experiences combined with my lead-by-example approach enable me to consult on all aspects of the business process, from strategic planning with Boards and CEOs to operations excellence. 

To my clients I bring 35+ years of experience in a variety of roles including CEO, COO / EVP / VP Operations / Engineering / Procurement/Supply Chain in high growth and established companies.

Specialties: Board experience, public sector CEO, private sector CEO, executive leadership in multi-facility union and union-free environments, strategic planning, construction, automation & robotics, lean manufacturing, tooling and capital equipment, union contract negotiation, engineering & supply chain management, sales & marketing, and project management.

experiences.title: Chief Executive Officer
experiences.description:
ITA is a crown agency responsible for all Skilled Trades Training for the Province of British Columbia.  
I was accountable for overall leadership and direction of a team of 115 employees, working in partnership with industry, labour, and training providers to serve 37,000 apprentices and 10,000 employer sponsors across BC and managed a $100M annual budget to ensure goals and objectives established by government and the Board were met. 

Accomplishments:
Transformed ITA to be a more customer-focused and industry-driven organization. Recognized as one of BC’s Top 100 Employers (2017 & 2018) and one of BC’s Great Places to Work (2016 - 2018).

Championed and led the successful implementation of the 29 recommendations from a Ministry directed mandate review.   

Took a leadership role in conjunction with Canadian Council Directors of Apprenticeship (CCDA) in implementing pan-Canadian harmonization of 30+ Red Seal trades affecting 95% of apprentices in Canada.

Doubled the number of indigenous apprentices in BC over 4 years.

experiences.title: Executive Director, Operations and Quality
experiences.description:
Starting as a Consultant to the President & CEO, for both Ebco Industries and Advanced Cyclotron Systems Inc. (ACSI), I was then hired as Executive Director, Operations and Quality for Ebco. In this role I was responsible for all operations and quality of a large contract manufacturer of heavy fabrications, machining and assemblies to the mining, hydro, oil & gas, pulp & paper, clean energy and cyclotron particle accelerator industries.

Accomplishments:
Achieved P&L success within 2 1/2 years.
Implemented quality system improvements to achieve a 50%+ reduction in rejects.
Introduced first Lean Manufacturing Cell for robotic welding of aluminum electrical transformer lids.

experiences.title: Executive Vice President Operations
experiences.description:
I was the Senior Operations Executive with full responsibility for a team of 500+ employees in 8 Manufacturing Plants and 2 Distribution Yards across North America. Responsible for annual purchases of $100 million and tooling/capital of $3 million.

Accomplishments:
Achieved annual savings of $3.4M through continuous improvement programs.
Restructured manufacturing between plants to increase throughput and reduce lead-time and freight.

Sylvain Garneau



To whom it may concern,

This reference letter is for Mr. Gary Herman who held the position of Executive Vice President Operations for VAE Nortrak North America.

Mr. Herman was responsible for the operations side of the business including nine manufacturing plants throughout North America, a Central Operations department including all purchasing, and two distribution yards.

Gary was brought into Nortrak as my replacement when I was promoted from the EVP Operations role to CEO in 2007. The past three years have been a time of great change at Nortrak.
A detailed Plant Utilization Plan that re-aligned how and where the company’s products were manufactured was rolled out by Mr. Herman.  The plan included significant capital investment in new equipment to increase the manufacturing capabilities as well as downsizing one plant and closing another. The plan was completed successfully and ahead of its three year timeline.

During Gary’s tenure, Nortrak built a Concrete Turnout tie plant and acquired a foundry and plastics injection molding company in the US Midwest. Both of these operations also reported to him. Throughout the difficult market conditions of 2008 and 2009, the company still managed to save $3.4 million per year through a Continuous Improvement Program which Mr. Herman directed.

 Gary possesses an extensive manufacturing background including a sound knowledge of lean manufacturing. His diverse experience in tooling and machinery as well as project and production manufacturing were definite assets. He is a strong leader who always works toward the best outcome for the company and is not easily deterred by others.

Mr. Herman has chosen to leave Nortrak to pursue other opportunities. His leadership, straightforwardness and honesty will be missed.

For a company seeking a senior executive I recommend Mr. Herman in an EVP Operations role or as a COO or CEO.


Sincerely,



Mr. Sylvain Garneau
CEO
